Contradict fact: The claim that promotional posters were put up over newly completed street art contradicts the fact that the image was digitally altered to include the posters covering the artwork.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the street art couldn't even last for a week, whereas the actual art was still intact when visited by AFP on December 17.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on misleading Facebook posts and does not provide substantial evidence for the promotional posters being put up over the street art.
Problematic assumption: There is no evidence of a problematic assumption in the provided claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the image was digitally altered and the promotional posters were not actually put up over the street art.
